src.models.hydrogen.model package

Submodules

src.models.hydrogen.model.actions module

A sequencer for actions in the model. This may change up a bit, but it is a place to assert control of the execution sequence for now

src.models.hydrogen.model.h2_model module

class src.models.hydrogen.model.h2_model.H2Model(*args, **kwds)[source]

Bases: ConcreteModel

poll_electric_demand() → dict[HI, float][source]

compute the electrical demand by region-year after solve

Note: we will use production * 1/eff to compute electrical demand

Parameters:
hm_type_

_description_

Returns:
dict[HI, float]

_description_

update_exchange_params(new_demand=None, new_electricity_price=None)[source]
src.models.hydrogen.model.h2_model.resolve(hm: H2Model, new_demand=None, new_electricity_price=None, test=False)[source]

For convenience: After building and solving the model initially:

new_demand: dict - new_demand[region,year] for H2demand in (region,year) new_electricity_price: dict - new_electricity_price[region,year]

then you can access the price duals and the quantities of electricity consumption as described in the comments in the solve() method

src.models.hydrogen.model.h2_model.solve(hm: H2Model)[source]

solve the model
